description.narrative: Families, communities, civil society, private sector and governmental agents in prioritized states with increased knowledge on the impact of violence on the lives of children., which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Education â€“ General, Evaluation And Research, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, Brazil's child protection system strengthened in its capacity to prevent and respond to violence against children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Families, communities, civil society, private sector and governmental agents in prioritized states with increased knowledge on the impact of violence on the lives of children.

description.narrative: Brazilian Society has been reached/sensitized by UNICEF communication initiatives that highlight the tackling of violence against children and adolescents as the main challenge for the implementation of the Convention on the Rights of the Child and for the full exercise of the rights ensured in this normative. The theme of armed violence (including homicide) and its impact on children schooling and on day to day lives has gained prominence in the focus of media coverage together with other situations that hamper the protection of children, to which UNICEF timely responded expressing preoccupation as well as raising awareness among the society. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/02/2020

title.narrative: Number of UNICEF supported research on the drivers of VAC
Number of people who participate in social and behavior change communication interventions promoting elimination of VAC through UNICEF programmes
